toc_entry.title: The Ants From Hell
toc_entry.description: Fire ants are on a relentless march across Texas, maiming, devouring, and stinging the living daylights out of everything in their path. We’ve tried to stop them, and it has only made them stronger.

toc_entry.title: Full Of Woe
toc_entry.description: You see them on Tv, adorable youngsters asking to be adopted. But the dreadful odyssey of the Wednesday’s Child rarely has a made-for-television happy ending.

toc_entry.title: Wright And Wrong
toc_entry.description: The congressional investigation that is focusing on Speaker Jim Wright’s ethics is missing the real problem —his judgment.

toc_entry.title: The Inventive Mr. Chu
toc_entry.description: Heat + pressure + yttrium + a politically savvy University of Houston physicist = a formula to change the world.

toc_entry.title: The Big Squeezy
toc_entry.description: Get hip to zydeco, the born-on-the-bayou sound with the accordion accent. Ready for it red hot? Check out a Saturday-night church dance in Houston.

toc_entry.title: Shades Of Summer
toc_entry.description: Let there be light, but leave us in the dark. Long before Ozona knew about ozone, Texans were inventing scads of ways to hide from rays.

toc_entry.title: The Dust Storm
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: Look out, Texas! If drought comes, can tons of blowing dirt be far behind?.

toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Kinky Friedman dropped out for a while, but it sure beat dropping dead. Now the warped warbler is back with a play, a movie deal, and murder mystery number three.
